intro: Bumelia auzuba, commonly known as Mexican gum tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and opposite, ovate to elliptical leaves. Its flowers are unisexual and clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Bumelia auzuba is often found in dry, open woods and is adapted to limestone soils.
